xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 09 July 2013
xwikidoc.content: <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm 12:00 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 12:01 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 12:37 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 12:39 <ravigarg27> hey sdumitriu1, had few queries 12:40 <ravigarg27> free? 12:41 <sdumitriu1> Hi 12:41 <sdumitriu1> Yes, go ahead 12:42 <ravigarg27> I get error while resolving this maven dependency "mastif-i2b2" 12:42 <ravigarg27> Failed to read artifact descriptor for org.mitre:jcarafe-core_2.9.1:jar:0.9.8.2: Could not transfer artifact org.mitre:jcarafe-core_2.9.1:pom:0.9.8.2 from/to mitrechatterrepository (http://rcf.mitre.org/project/chatter/repo/): null to http://rcf.mitre.org/project/chatter/repo/org/mitre/jcarafe-core_2.9.1/0.9.8.2/jcarafe-core_2.9.1-0.9.8.2.pom: UnresolvedAddressException -> [Help 1] 12:46 <sdumitriu1> I think they're using a repository that's private to their network 12:46 <sdumitriu1> Which dependency triggered this? 12:49 <ravigarg27> mastif-i2b2 i only i.e <dependency> <groupId>net.sf.mastif</groupId> <artifactId>mastif-i2b2</artifactId> <version>1.4</version> </dependency> 12:51 <ravigarg27> I found it here http://repo.jfrog.org/artifactory/libs-releases/net/sf/mastif/ but dunno how to use that 12:51 <sdumitriu1> But it's available in the central repo, you don't need to get it from another repo 12:53 <sdumitriu1> Ah, I see the problem 12:54 <sdumitriu1> It requires org.mitre:jcarafe-core_2.9.1 but it's available as net.sf.carafe.jcarafe:jcarafe-core_2.9.1 12:54 <sdumitriu1> So you need to exclude it 12:56 <sdumitriu1> http://pastebin.com/mAKXap4d 12:57 <ravigarg27> okay thanx I was searching for how to exclude certain dependency 12:57 <ravigarg27> its very simple indeed 12:59 <ravigarg27> just one more thing I included this as you suggested START_OPTS="$START_OPTS -Xmx1512m -XX:MaxPermSize=192m -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=5005" 13:00 <ravigarg27> but it gives handshake failed error Debugger failed to attach: handshake failed - received >GET / HTTP/1.1< - expected >JDWP-Handshake< 13:00 <ravigarg27> when I it open on port 5005 13:00 <ravigarg27> *open it 13:01 <sdumitriu1> Hm... 13:01 <sdumitriu1> Oh 13:01 <sdumitriu1> How are you opening it? 13:01 <sdumitriu1> You're not supposed to open it in the browser 13:02 <ravigarg27> ohh 13:02 <sdumitriu1> From Eclipse 13:02 <sdumitriu1> Run -> Run configurations... 13:03 <sdumitriu1> No 13:03 <sdumitriu1> Run -> Debug configurations... 13:03 <sdumitriu1> Remote Java Application 13:03 <sdumitriu1> new 13:04 <sdumitriu1> Select a module as the project 13:04 <sdumitriu1> Use 5005 as the port 13:04 <sdumitriu1> And attach other modules in the Source path 13:05 <ravigarg27> ohh okay 13:05 <sdumitriu1> Then set breakpoints where you want the execution to stop 13:05 <sdumitriu1> And interact with the application through the normal 8080 port 13:06 <sdumitriu1> When the execution hits a breakpoint, Eclipse will open the debug mode and stop 13:13 <sdumitriu1> mfiume: You should be on #medsavant 14:13 <mfiume> has left #ccm
